msg: Allowed XSLT parameters to take any kind of object

msg: Fixed the test case now, though requires the next version of dom4j

author: jstrachan
msg: Added test case for Howard Moore's problem with the use of ampersands inside of XML documents.

author: jstrachan
msg: Added test case for Richard's bug

author: jstrachan
msg: Patched code to work properly with dom4j 1.1 and greater. Also now support all JSP scopes as defined by the forthcoming JSPTL library XML tags. So $cookie:foo or $header:foo or $param:foo or $initParan:foo or $session:foo can be used in XPath expressions to explicitly refer to a specific scope of attribute or parameter, cookie or header.
